title: Refactor to use doccano as a reusable django application
body:
Feature description
---------
This project is very useful, however, it would be great if I could also use the application in an existing django project.  Having a full blown SPA and deployment seems like overkill for some of the functionality, especially if you already are using django and/or django admin.

So, I would propose abstracting the server/api as a standalone django application, maybe in another git repo, and using that as a django app in this repo.  This would allow for this package to be used in existing django applications.

I have already forked the repo and refactored to make it work for my purposes. 

https://github.com/ajbeach2/doccano


With my forked changes, I did however remove everything that wasn't a server side rendered required dependency. I also had to remove the webpack loader. However with these changes i am able to include doccano with only the following changes to to my existing django app:


``` bath
pip install pip install -e git+https://git@github.com/ajbeach2/doccano@master#egg=django-doccano
```

```python
# settings.y
INSTALLED_APPS = [
    'django.contrib.admin',
    'django.contrib.auth',
    'django.contrib.contenttypes',
    'django.contrib.sessions',
    'django.contrib.messages',
    'django.contrib.staticfiles',
    'rest_framework',
    'widget_tweaks',
    'polymorphic',
    'django_filters',
    'doccano',
]
```

```python
# urls.py
urlpatterns = [
    ....
    path('doccano/', include('doccano.urls')
]
```
